videos.title: GIVĒON - TWENTIES (2025)
videos.additional_info:
GIVĒON - TWENTIES (2025)
A cinematic reflection on youth, ambition, and the bittersweet passage of time. Directed by Loris Russier, with stunning cinematography by Edouard Le Grelle and rich, moody color grading by Jacob McKee, the video immerses viewers in a visually striking journey through late-night cityscapes, fleeting romance, and moments of introspection. Blending elegance with raw emotion, "Twenties" captures the highs and lows of coming of age, wrapped in GIVĒON’s signature soulful sound. Director - @lorisrussier Production Company - @lotumn_ Executive Producer / Producer - @autumnmaschi Executive Producer - @lorisrussier Director Of Photography - @edlegrelle Creative Director: @riko_akme Giveon Stylist - @yashuasimmons Management - @eeekksss, Simon Gebrelul Epic Head of Video Production - @gstarsz Starring - @ayomideadeduro
Technique - Double Exposure , Silhouette
Director - Loris Russier
DOP - Edouard Le Grelle
Editor - Jacob McKee
Original Source - Link

videos.title: Sam Akpro - Death By Entertainment (2023)
videos.description: The music video for "Death By Entertainment" by Sam Akpro, directed by Pedro Takahashi, presents the artist and his band as Wall Street-style bankers caught in an endless loop of hard work and intense leisure. The video employs split screens and dynamic camera movements to convey a melancholic yet captivating atmosphere, mirroring the song's themes of repetitive daily life and the blurring lines between day and night due to physical and mental exhaustion.
videos.additional_info:
Sam Akpro - Death By Entertainment (2023)
The music video for "Death By Entertainment" by Sam Akpro, directed by Pedro Takahashi, presents the artist and his band as Wall Street-style bankers caught in an endless loop of hard work and intense leisure. The video employs split screens and dynamic camera movements to convey a melancholic yet captivating atmosphere, mirroring the song's themes of repetitive daily life and the blurring lines between day and night due to physical and mental exhaustion.
Technique - Double Exposure
Director - Pedro Takahashi
DOP - Max Conran
Colorist - Connor Coolbear, Electric Theatre Collective

videos.title: Offset - CODE ft. Moneybagg Yo (2022)
videos.description: The music video for "CODE" by Offset featuring Moneybagg Yo is visually striking and matches the energy and themes of the song. In the video, both artists perform in various gritty, urban settings, enhancing the tough and assertive lyrics of the track. The video features scenes with luxury cars, dynamic group performances, and visually engaging effects that emphasize the rhythm and mood of the music. The overall aesthetic is dark and stylish, with a focus on street fashion and a portrayal of a lavish lifestyle, which is common in hip hop videos. The video complements the song's themes of success, power, and street credibility.
videos.additional_info:
Offset - CODE ft. Moneybagg Yo (2022)
The music video for "CODE" by Offset featuring Moneybagg Yo is visually striking and matches the energy and themes of the song. In the video, both artists perform in various gritty, urban settings, enhancing the tough and assertive lyrics of the track. The video features scenes with luxury cars, dynamic group performances, and visually engaging effects that emphasize the rhythm and mood of the music. The overall aesthetic is dark and stylish, with a focus on street fashion and a portrayal of a lavish lifestyle, which is common in hip hop videos. The video complements the song's themes of success, power, and street credibility.
Technique - Double Exposure , Mixed Media
Director - Claire Arnold
DOP - Taylor McIntosh
Editor - Anthony Miralles
Colorist - Megan Lee
Original Source - Link

videos.title: Omega - Road to the Olympics (2024)
videos.description: The "Omega - Road to the Olympics 2024" commercial celebrates Omega's role as the Official Timekeeper for the Paris 2024 Olympics, a position they've held since 1932. The commercial features athletes training and competing, emphasizing Omega's precision and innovation in timekeeping technology. It also highlights the launch of a special edition Seamaster watch, designed to commemorate the upcoming Olympics.
videos.additional_info:
Omega - Road to the Olympics (2024)
The "Omega - Road to the Olympics 2024" commercial celebrates Omega's role as the Official Timekeeper for the Paris 2024 Olympics, a position they've held since 1932. The commercial features athletes training and competing, emphasizing Omega's precision and innovation in timekeeping technology. It also highlights the launch of a special edition Seamaster watch, designed to commemorate the upcoming Olympics.
Technique - Double Exposure , Echo print , Motion Blur
Director - Marius Gonzalez
DOP - Mathieu Plainfossé

videos.title: Duplication clip by Matthias Brown (2013)
videos.additional_info:
Duplication clip by Matthias Brown (2013)
Animation from artist Matthias Brown, also known as 'TraceLoops'. In this clip, we're seeing the combination of rotoscoped heads from the same person rotating along an X-axis in a black 'void-like' environment, as though on a lazy-susan. It's easy to identify a duplication technique from the clip. Harder to pick between 'Echo printing' and 'Double exposure'. We labeled it as both since it has properties from both techniques. Like most clips, there isn't a clear-cut category it fits under.
Technique - Double Exposure , Duplication , Echo print , Void
Director - Matthias Brown (TraceLoops)
Original Source - Link

videos.title: Doechii - DENIAL IS A RIVER (2025)
videos.additional_info:
Doechii - DENIAL IS A RIVER (2025)
Doechii's "Denial Is a River" (2025) reimagines her life as a '90s sitcom, inspired by Family Matters, with a nostalgic title sequence and a star-studded cast including Zack Fox, ScHoolboy Q, and Teezo Touchdown. Blending humor and introspection, the video playfully navigates sitcom-style scenarios that reflect her personal and professional journey. Directors: Carlos Acosta & James Mackel EPs: Moosa Tiffith & Anthony “Top Dawg” Tiffith Production Company: LOTUMN Executive Producer / Producer: Autumn Maschi Executive Producer: Loris Russier Creative Director: Doechii, Moosa Tiffith, & BMR.Nem Director of Photography: Nico Aguilar Production Designer: Hensel Martinez TDE Creative Producer: Langston Siebens Production Manager: Kai Lusk Production Coordinator: Kate Kramnaia, Alex Turner 1st AD: Daniel Bennaiem 2nd AD: Delaney Forrey 1st AC: Hannah Lee 2nd AC: McKay Todd, Marianna Vashchilenko DIT: Pete Aguirre Camera Operator: Chloe Smolkin, Cordell Jomha
